page.title: 16SOCIAL CONCERNS IN BALFRON
page.content: A social{survey,}involving 250 households in the Balfron area, indicated that 99% of the adults were happy to be living in the district. Their{reasons were varied,}but the most common were: the peace and quiet, the pure clean air, the friendliness of the people, the attractive houses and the good schools. When questioned about how the village had changed, responses varied according to the length of time spent in the area. However, the general concensus was, that on the whole, {changes}had been for the better- more {houses}(both council and private); new primary school, clinic, fire station and telephone exchange. Changes which did not meet with general approval were the reduced bus- service and the introduction of double decker buses.
